text: Just listening to this song makes me sad.  It reminds me of how bitter the ending to Mother 3 was.  And yet, at the same time, it carries such a feeling of hope...
author: Tristan Buss

text: I sat here with this comment box open, with the intention of posting some long and rambling comment of praise towards the Mother series, yet I can't think of a way to convey my feelings exactly. My love for Mother is just so indescribable! Thank you for putting so much Mother on your playlist!
author: prince apoopoo

text: This is, hands down, the best gameboy advanced, and maybe, the best handheld game of all time. No caps, no exclamation points. It is just that amazing
author: YoshiRxs97

text:
Amazing song: Once again, really makes you feel what the characters are feeling at that moment. Be it tenderness, sadness, or relief, it really moves you.

On a sidenote, no Duster's Theme? I find that to be the best and most memorable music in the game.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: This game has the saddest story, but still has the charm of the first two. It such a wonderful game.
author: The Dood

text:
@VGKing I guess those are valid complaints.  I guess it wasn't your cup of tea.  As I said, we're different.  I thought the battle system was better than Earthbound's, though.  It's essentially the same thing except with the music added on.  I thought the game telling you you could ignore the music thing was so if you're like me and completely deaf to beat, they're reassuring you that it's not required.

And I didn't thumb you down, bro =P
author: ProjectJ

text: @VGKing XDDDD!  So you like Earthbound, and yet you can't enjoy Mother 3?  We're so different, you and I =P

text: I have listened to this song immediately after every family member's funeral I have gone to since first playing this game.

author: D0rcus

text: @IRSPONGEBOB Not to mention the fact that the game came out in 2006, when the GBA was pretty much fully phased out. Just as an additional frame of reference, the DS Lite came out a month before Mother 3 in Japan, and two months after everywhere else. Times had changed already, so your aforementioned rumor would make perfect sense.
author: My YouTube Channel

text:
@SingTingz31 idunno. NOA & NOE being lazy? NCL forcing them not to localize it?


Actually, theirs rumors going on that Nintendo of Japan told NOA not to localize anymore GBA games, so that their would be more of a focus on the DS.
